title: DES: Should util.is_nan check for complex('nan')?
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['pandas/core/dtypes/missing.py', 'pandas/core/missing.py', 'pandas/core/nanops.py', 'pandas/core/arrays/period.py', 'pandas/core/arrays/datetimelike.py'], 'reasoning': "1. pandas/core/dtypes/missing.py: This is where the main isna() function lives, and should be updated to detect complex('nan'). This single change will propagate correct nan detection.
2. pandas/core/missing.py: Uses isna() for missing data routines; any deduplicated manual complex nan detection can be removed after isna() update.
3. pandas/core/nanops.py: Handles nan operations and uses isna(); should be verified for benefitting from new logic.
4 & 5. pandas/core/arrays/period.py and pandas/core/arrays/datetimelike.py: These modules implement/override custom missing/nan handling, often calling isna(); should be updated/refactored as necessary."}
